chunk_metadata.created_by: Enhanced Markdown Chunker with Comprehensive Context

works.Name: Sinfonia g-Moll
works.Notes: Created in 1949 in Florence during a very creative phase; faced gender discrimination at 1942 premiere
works.Long Description: This symphony was created in 1949 in Florence, in a very creative phase by Matilde Capuis. One year earlier she received two composition prizes: “Premio Quartetto Veneziano” (1948), “Premio Circolo Universitario”, Bolzano (1948).
works.Short Description: Symphony in G minor composed in 1949 Florence

works.Name: Variations on an unknown theme
works.Notes: Divided into 8 sections; variations 1-7 in D minor, final variation in D major
works.Long Description: The variations on a theme by an unknown composer are divided into 8 sections: Adagio - Allegro energico Adagio - Allegro scherzoso - Adagio - Presto - Moderato - Allegro giusto. Each variation is very original. Variations 1 to 7 are in D minor, the last variation in D major.
works.Short Description: Orchestral variations on an unknown theme in 8 sections

works.Name: Happy Birthday Celebration
works.Notes: Commissioned by the New Orchestra of Westchester for children's concerts; conductor Paul Dunkel
works.Long Description: Commissioned by the New Orchestra of Westchester for the inauguration of a new concert series for children and youth. Paul Dunkel, conductor. Contents: We went to a German restaurant, I was punished by not being allowed to have a party, We all had a very good time, They all sang 'Happy Birthday', The things I feared would go wrong, did not turn out so badly after all, A Minimal Party, Aleatory Birthday Party
works.Short Description: Orchestral suite for children's concerts about birthday celebrations

works.Name: Evening Music, Soundtrack for a Dark Street
works.Notes: Dark mood piece; tells a story like movie music without a movie
works.Long Description: "Soundtrack for a Dark Street" is a piece in dark moods. It tells a story for the listener's mind-like movie music without a movie.
works.Short Description: Orchestral fantasy with electric guitar in dark mood

works.Name: Nocturnal Fantasy with Ocean Waves
works.Notes: Uses taped ocean waves and seagull cries blended with orchestra
works.Scoring: 2(Picc-Fl).2.2(2B-Klar).2(K-Fg).-4.3.3.1., Perc, Vibr, Glksp, Hrf, Klav, Str
works.Long Description: Taped ocean waves and the cry of seagulls blend with the symphonic orchestra forming a peaceful, contemplative mood in the first section, and evoke images of the nocturnal ocean.
works.Short Description: Orchestral fantasy with tape of ocean waves and seagulls

works.Name: Elfen
works.Notes: Based on texts by J.W. Goethe; inspired by Oriental Music Festival Durham 1979
works.Scoring: 2.2.2.2.-0.1.2.0., Timp, Perc, Mar, Campana, Hrf, Str
works.Long Description: Starting with small motives the music develops a fantastic sound. It is inspired by two texts of Goethe. The percussion instruments abduct the listener into the world of fairy and evoke something phantasmagorical. The clarinet has some solo-parts.
works.Short Description: Orchestral tone poem based on Goethe texts about fairies

works.Name: Ausatmen
works.Notes: Based on music from 6th scene of opera "Medea" op. 71; humorous ragtime section
works.Long Description: "Exhalation" is followed by a lyrical dramatic part (inhalation) reminiscent of a Russian blizzard, a pointed ragtime - a real exhale: funny, light, humorous. Obsessive compaction finds the most beautiful balance for relaxed pleasure. A witty, uplifting work by Olga Magidenko.
works.Short Description: Orchestral fantasy with ragtime section based on opera Medea

works.Name: Symphony No. 5 (Wellen)
works.Notes: First symphony from cycle "Naturgewalt" after Greek pagan gods; includes world music themes
works.Long Description: First symphony from the cycle "Naturgewalt" after Greek pagan gods. Waves bring sounds and melodies from all over the world to the beach. An Argentine tango, a Viennese waltz, songs from Asia, mysterious motifs from northern Russia can be heard. The musical themes unfold, show themselves and are gradually broken by the waves and destroyed to annihilation.
works.Short Description: Contemporary symphony with world music themes depicting waves

chunk_info.processing_notes: Extracted 8 complete orchestral works from this chunk, including symphonies, orchestral suites, tone poems and variations by Matilde Capuis, Ruth Schonthal and Olga Magidenko. All works have sufficient detail including composer, title, and instrumentation/scoring information.
